description: [Sandworm Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0034) has used [CaddyWiper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0693), [SDelete](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0195), and the [BlackEnergy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0089) KillDisk component to overwrite files on victim systems. (Citation: US-CERT Ukraine Feb 2016)(Citation: ESET Telebots June 2017)(Citation: Mandiant-Sandworm-Ukraine-2022) Additionally, [Sandworm Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0034) has used the JUNKMAIL tool to overwrite files with null bytes.(Citation: mandiant_apt44_unearthing_sandworm)

external_references.description: Cherepanov, A.. (2017, June 30). TeleBots are back: Supply chain attacks against Ukraine. Retrieved June 11, 2020.

Ken Proska, John Wolfram, Jared Wilson, Dan Black, Keith Lunden, Daniel Kapellmann Zafra, Nathan Brubaker, Tyler Mclellan, Chris Sistrunk. (2023, November 9). Sandworm Disrupts Power in Ukraine Using a Novel Attack Against Operational Technology. Retrieved March 28, 2024.
Roncone, G. et al. (n.d.). APT44: Unearthing Sandworm. Retrieved July 11, 2024.
US-CERT. (2016, February 25). ICS Alert (IR-ALERT-H-16-056-01) Cyber-Attack Against Ukrainian Critical Infrastructure. Retrieved June 10, 2020.
